abstract: Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in the Moody’s Corporation for the sixth time since July, after the ratings company suffered profit declines, lawsuits and criticism from regulators.
snippet: Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in the Moody’s Corporation for the sixth time since July, after the ratings company suffered profit declines, lawsuits and criticism from regulators.
lead_paragraph: Berkshire Hathaway, led by Warren E. Buffett, cut its stake in the Moody’s Corporation for the sixth time since July, after the ratings company suffered profit declines, lawsuits and criticism from regulators.

headline.main: Berkshire Hathaway Cuts Stake in Moody’s
headline.print_headline: Berkshire Hathaway Cuts Stake in Moody’s

abstract: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway said Tuesday that Comcast Chief Operating Officer Stephen Burke has been elected as a director, helping broaden a board that consists mainly of long-time insiders.
snippet: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway said Tuesday that Comcast Chief Operating Officer Stephen Burke has been elected as a director, helping broaden a board that consists mainly of long-time insiders.
lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway  said Tuesday that Comcast its chief operating officer, Stephen Burke, had been elected as a director, helping broaden a board that consists mainly of long-time insiders, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Buffett Broadens Berkshire Board With Burke

abstract: Warren Buffett, billionaire chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, told employees of Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corp. that he’s buying the railroad because of its position in the U.S. West.
snippet: Warren Buffett, billionaire chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, told employees of Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corp. that he’s buying the railroad because of its position in the U.S. West.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett, billionaire chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, told employees of Burlington Northern Santa Fe that he’s buying the railroad because of its position in the American West, Bloomberg News reported.

abstract: Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in Moody’s for the sixth time since July after the ratings company was hit by profit declines, lawsuits and criticism from regulators.
snippet: Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in Moody’s for the sixth time since July after the ratings company was hit by profit declines, lawsuits and criticism from regulators.
lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in Moody’s for the sixth time since July after the ratings company was hit by profit declines, lawsuits and criticism from regulators, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Berkshire Downgrades Its Stake in Moody’s
